thread.title: Watch pregnant Beyonce cradle growing bump during magical Grammy Awards performance
thread.title_full: Watch pregnant Beyonce cradle growing bump during magical Grammy Awards performance

author: Zoe Shenton
title: Watch pregnant Beyonce cradle growing bump during magical Grammy Awards performance
text:
Watch pregnant Beyonce cradle growing bump during magical Grammy Awards performance The superstar received a standing ovation from husband Jay Z and daughter Blue Ivy Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Beyonce STUNS in first performance since announcing pregnancy Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
She might not have walked the Grammy Awards red carpet, but Beyonce made sure she pulled out all the stops for her stand-out performance. 
Introduced by her mother Tina Knowles, the superstar sang ballads Love Drought and Sandcastles. 
Dressed in an ethereal gold gown and sparkling gold crown, the expectant star held her growing belly as she appeared on stage with her backing dancers. 
As she took a seat on a huge chair at the end of a long table that was surrounded by her dancers, she broke out into song. (Photo: Getty Images North America) (Photo: Getty Images North America) Recording artist Beyonce (Photo: Getty Images North America) 
Coloured petals fell from the sky and covered the floor below. 
As she finished, cameras panned to her husband Jay Z who was giving her a standing ovation and adorable daughter Blue who was also clapping her mum. Blue Ivy Carter and Jay Z (Photo: Getty Images North America) Recording artist Beyonce (Photo: Getty Images North America) (Photo: Getty Images North America) (Photo: REUTERS) 
Viewers were flooding Twitter with praise for the star, saying it was one of her most "beautiful" performances to date. 
"Beyonce was serving pregnant goddess realness and I was living!" said one, while another joked, "Was I just baptised I think I was!"
